Bilateral conductive hearing losses.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

right stapedial fixation.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

otosclerosis.context: Bilateral conductive hearing losses with right stapedial fixation secondary to otosclerosis.

endotracheal intubation.context: Endotracheal intubation carried out by Dr. X.

1% Xylocaine with epinephrine.context: Slow infiltration of the external canal accomplished with 1% Xylocaine with epinephrine.

incision.context: A limited incision was made in the earlobe harvesting a small bit of fat from the earlobe that was diced and the donor site closed with interrupted sutures of 5-0 nylon.

good mobility of malleus and incus.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

no movement of stapes.context: Palpation of the malleus revealed good mobility of both it and incus, but no movement of the stapes was identified.

fenestration created in footplate.context: The fenestration created in the footplate was nearly perfect for placement of the piston and therefore additional laser vaporization was not required in this particular situation.

0.6 mm piston.context: A small bit of additional footplate was removed with a right angle hook to accommodate the 0.6 mm piston.

4.25 mm slim shaft wire Teflon piston.context: The measuring device was used and a 4.25 mm slim shaft wire Teflon piston chosen.

Gelfoam and antibiotic ointment.context: The external canal packed with small pledgets of Gelfoam and antibiotic ointment.
